The paper deals with graph theory and algorithms for determining vertex colourings, which are topics that are commonly studied in computer science. The use of the term "linear time algorithm" suggests that the paper is focused on algorithmic efficiency, which is a key concern in many areas of computer science. The sub-category cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) is a likely fit because the paper deals with graph theory and combinatorial problems. The sub-category cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is also a likely fit because the paper discusses algorithmic techniques for solving a specific problem. The sub-category cs.CG (Computational Geometry) is a possibility because the paper deals with graph structures, which can be thought of as geometric objects. The sub-category cs.CC (Computational Complexity) is a possibility because the paper discusses the efficiency of algorithms. The sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning) is a less likely fit, but it is possible that the paper uses machine learning techniques to solve the problem.
